text: Poured as part of a "Derivation flight" with blends 1-7 including Double Barrel (sans blend 5). Again a thick black with little/no carbonation. Nose is much more integrated and less brash than blend 1. Vanilla, dark chocolate especially, but not a lot of malt backbone. Round and integrated in the mouth, a bit less thick than blend 1. Lots of sweet vanilla, for me it was missing much backbone though. Lots of adjuncts.

Bottle 750ml. shared at [ A Day To Sink All Sea Shepards tasting. ], Brussels, Belgium. [ As Side Project Derivation Blend #2 ]. [ White Wax ]. Clear dark black brown color with a small, frothy - fizzy, good lacing, mostly lasting to diminishing, beige head. Aroma is heavy malty, roasted, chocolate, vanilla, alcohol, cacao, light coffee. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate bitter with a long long duration, alcohol, chocolate, vanilla, coconut, roasted, cacao. Body is medium to full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft, finish feel is light alcoholic. [20160917]
 9-4-9-5-18

Bottle shared at A Day To Sink All Sea Shepards tasting. Full lineup of 1-6 + DB. Black with a ring tan head. Aroma of big vanilla, chocolate, caramel, toffee, soy. Flavour is heavy sweet, moderate to heavy bitter and big umami. Full bodied with a thick chewy texture and soft carbonation. Having tried this against the rest I can see why this is considered the best. Superb. [17-09-2016]

750 ml bottle shared at the original Chez Moeder Lambics cellar. Thanks Anton! Black color with beige brown head. Malty aroma, roasted, chocolate, cocoa, vanilla, coconut, light spicy notes, wood. Moderate to heavy sweet and light bitter taste like aroma. Almost full silky creamy body with soft carbonation.

Extreme & manifold thanks to fux!!! 750 ml. bottle sampled. Black with small mocha head. Nose is insanely rich sweet mocha, chocolate, coffee, huge pralines & sweet coffee. Taste is amazing mocha, chocolate, coffee, sweet, huge pralines, vanilla, Thick rich, decadent. Otherworldly good.

@ A day to sink all seasheppards. Thnx for sharing, everyone !! Pours black, no head. Smell is vanilla. Silky. Taste is intense, bit bitter, vanilla. rather sweet. complex, somehow, between pure extremism, this is balanced.
Sample at Boulevardia 2016. Comes black with a small brown head. Aroma of vanilla, chocolate, bourbon, and malt. Taste is vanilla, chocolate, roasted malt, bourbon, caramel, and wood. Superb.

(From notes; tasted 7/11/2015). Bottle. Heavy vanilla paces the strong aroma laced with dark chocolate, musty oak, and not nearly as much bourbon as Blend #1. The pour resembles used motor oil topped with a beige head that hangs around. A delightful blend of dark chocolate, vanilla, burnt grains and whiskey greets the tongue, but overall the flavor isnt as complex as the first blends. Fairly thick body. A very nice barrel-aged imperial stout, but I prefer Blend #1 a tad more over this one.

Bottle... This beer rocks! Pours ink-black with a mid-sized, brown head. The aroma features gobs of dark chocolate, hot fudge, dark berries, whiskey, pouch tobacco and the most inviting vanilla component Ive ever run across. Super full-bodied with a silken, thick mouthfeel and adequate carbonation. The flavor is a lush collage of bittersweet brownie brittle, deeply roasted mocha and pouch tobacco with a delicious, lingering, vanilla and bourbon finish. I LOVE THIS BEER! A shout out to 50belair for providing me the chance to enjoy this world-class treat!

Bottle shared by john, thank you! Pour is amazing viscous black with a thin ring of sanguine foam. Aroma is rich and sweet with notes of wheat, roasted malt, honey, whiskey, and light smoke. Lots going on. Flavor is just staggering: Flavor starts with toffee malt and marshmallow. That evolves into wheat and light smoke with lots of vanilla and bourbon notes. Palate is crazy thick and smooth. Just the most rich, well - balanced huge stout I have had. Lingering light smoke and toffee malt for minutes. As good as advertised.

Pours dark brown with a tan head. The aroma has lots of soy sauce off the bat, chocolate, fudge, coconut, bourbon and heavy smooth roast. It has a full rich body with soft carbonation. The taste has heavy chocolate, vanilla, cream, soy sauce, cacao and some spice. The finish has very heavy alcohol and powdered cocoa. Very nice imperial stout, but showed the 15% alcohol more than I would have liked.

750 ml bottle at the Side Project Cellar. Pours a deep, dark, murky - but not quite opaque, given highlights around the edges - brown with a small brown head that settles into a small lasting ring. Vanilla in the aroma is what immediately sets this apart from the other one, but its never overdone. I worried itd be too sweet as it warmed, but that wasnt the case. Its a gorgeous sweet layer atop fudge, toasted marshmallow, coconut, roasted malts, toasted brown sugar, marzipan, oak, caramel, and cocoa beans. Full-bodied, just a little bit thicker than Blend #1, with a smooth, velvety, sweet mouthfeel that coats the palate. Modest carbonation. I initially liked #1 better, but #2 is as well done as a barrel-aged stout with vanilla can be. It never overpowers with sweetness, remaining in perfect balance all the way. I couldnt pick a favorite between the two, and both kept getting their scores bumped. Astonishingly good. This is way beyond my ridiculously high expectations.

Motor oil. Some chocolate. Caramel apple. Bourbon. Tasted at my Whales and Whimps bottle share. Thx John. Tasted side by side with Hideout Tiramisu and Bourbon County Vanilla Rye. Very strong.  Some soy.
Dark brown pour, brown head. Very good but not quite as amazing as blend 1. Deep chocolate and vanilla notes, some smoke, bourbon, caramel and charred oak.
750 bottle. Vanilla, bourbon, sweetness, smoke, dark roasted malts. Perfect balance, creamy, oily thickish body. Amazing stuff. Had this next to 14 BVDL, thinking its better.
Bottle from Dustin. Black pour with small tan head. Aroma of vanilla, chocolate and whiskey. Taste is bourbon, vanilla and light oak and smoke. Excellent!

Bottle thanks to Dustin. Pours motor oil black with small tan head that lasts. The aroma is strong vanilla, chocolate, roast, wood. Thick mouth, strong chocolate, vanilla, roast, wood, bourbon, chewy, very impressive.
Sampled at Sweeneys. Black as ink. Bourbon barrel vanilla aroma. Nice. Flavor similar. Some cinnamon and roast. Very good. In my wheel house.

Bottle. Dark brown pour with an oily sheen a chocolate head. Big chocolate and vanilla bouquet. Loads of chocolate, oak, vanilla bean, caramel, and dark roasted malt notes. Fantastic body and mouthfeel.
Amazingly thick, huge palate. Massive amounts of rich vanilla. Luxurious with subtle hints of smoke and dark chocolate. Amazing beer

750 mL bottle poured into a snifter. Inky black with a medium mocha head. Thin collar. Huge amounts of vanilla. Fudgy dark chocolate. Lightly smokey and strong roasted malt. Taste has a huge amount of vanilla also. Heavy chocolate fudgy sweetness, Light smokiness that really just blends into a bitter roasted malt flavor. Boozy. Extremely heavy. Low carbonation. Extremely good, but extremely sweet and boozy.
Bottle - Pours dark black. Nose is lots of bourbon, oak, vanilla, and chocolate. Taste is fudgy dark chocolate, bourbon, vanilla, oak.
